Posts.Content: msdmckee wrote: Has anyone else had the US tech ask you to HUM during an ultrasound?  She indicated the radiologists had just started this addition to screening.......when they locate an area of concern, they measure it, take a still picture, then have you hum and take another picture?  Why fore do ya think? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Had Me HUM during ultrasound msdmckee horsewing

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2010 05:35PM msdmckee wrote: What a great piece of information, Thank you........I think when I go in for the first of April images, I will "change my pitch" and see what happens......The US tech is now used to my curious questions and generally accomodates (or tries to) my requests.  The why of humming, she did not know.  We did talk about pitch and frequency creating different waves, but neither of us could figure out how it would differentiate in normal tissue, fluid or malignancies.  Any other input is appreciated!
Posts.Title: Had Me HUM during ultrasound msdmckee horsewing

Posts.Content: msdmckee wrote: I didn't have rads w/my treatment, but now my Dad will be having rads and chemo.  I am looking for things to help him.........these will be head and neck targets.  Any suggestions?  Mouth care, washes?  Lotion or potions for skin care?  How 'bout food?  Do you suppose we will need to get a blender to keep his nutrition up?  ANy recipes? This seems to scare me more than when I went through treatment.  Not sure what to do, but this board was great help the first time around!  Thank you all so very much>>>>>>>>>> Log in to post a reply
